DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the associated virus pathogen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Joined in some kind of relationship._An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Joined in some kind of relationship.:An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope.

Concepts.definition: Joined in some kind of relationship.

An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2020-12-3 AK Created for NCI-INC0536652 - 20C0070 Curation and import 11.10.2020

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: An obligate anaerobic, weakly Gram-positive species of mycobacterium that is the cause of most cases of tuberculosis.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An obligate anaerobic, weakly Gram-positive species of mycobacterium that is the cause of most cases of tuberculosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An obligate anearobic, weakly Gram-positive species of mycobacterium that is the cause of most cases of tuberculosis.

Concepts.definition: An obligate anaerobic, weakly Gram-positive species of mycobacterium that is the cause of most cases of tuberculosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A species of enveloped and brick-shaped viruses in the Poxviridae family and Molluscipoxvirus genus. The genome is composed of non-segmented, linear double-stranded DNA. Molluscum contagiosum viruses are found in humans and can cause the disease Molluscum contagiosum. Molluscum contagiosum viruses are transmitted via direct person-to-person contact and contact with infected fomites.

Concepts.definition: A species of enveloped and brick-shaped viruses in the Poxviridae family and Molluscipoxvirus genus. The genome is composed of non-segmented, linear double-stranded DNA. Molluscum contagiosum viruses are found in humans and can cause the disease Molluscum contagiosum. Molluscum contagiosum viruses are transmitted via direct person-to-person contact and contact with infected fomites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two polyomaviruses found in humans. JC virus can infect the respiratory system, kidneys, or brain, sometimes causing the fatal progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in the latter case. It is very widespread with approximately 80 percent of the adult population in the United States having antibodies to and JC. (from WordIQ.com)

Concepts.definition: One of two polyomaviruses found in humans. JC virus can infect the respiratory system, kidneys, or brain, sometimes causing the fatal progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in the latter case. It is very widespread with approximately 80 percent of the adult population in the United States having antibodies to and JC. (from WordIQ.com)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans.

Concepts.definition: A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. 11.24.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gammaherpesvirus that contributes to the development of Kaposi sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: A gammaherpesvirus that contributes to the development of Kaposi sarcoma.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. 11.24.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A human herpesvirus that has been found in certain lymphoproliferative disorders, replicates in a number of different types of leukocytes, and is associated with the childhood disease roseola (exanthema subitum).

Concepts.definition: A human herpesvirus that has been found in certain lymphoproliferative disorders, replicates in a number of different types of leukocytes, and is associated with the childhood disease roseola (exanthema subitum).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.

Concepts.definition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genus of the family herpesviridae, subfamily betaherpesvirinae, infecting the salivary glands, liver, spleen, lungs, eyes, and other organs, in which they produce characteristically enlarged cells with intranuclear inclusions.

Concepts.definition: A genus of the family herpesviridae, subfamily betaherpesvirinae, infecting the salivary glands, liver, spleen, lungs, eyes, and other organs, in which they produce characteristically enlarged cells with intranuclear inclusions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A double stranded DNA virus in the polyomavirus family. It is widespread but usually causes an asymptomatic infection, except in immunocompromised individuals.

Concepts.definition: A double stranded DNA virus in the polyomavirus family. It is widespread but usually causes an asymptomatic infection, except in immunocompromised individuals.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of DNA containing viruses which infect mammals and are capable of causing respiratory disease, including one form of the common cold.

Concepts.definition: A group of DNA containing viruses which infect mammals and are capable of causing respiratory disease, including one form of the common cold.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. 11.24.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare systemic and life-threatening infection associated with vaccination with the live attenuated strain of Mycobacterium bovis, bacillus Calmette-Guerin.

Concepts.definition: A rare systemic and life-threatening infection associated with vaccination with the live attenuated strain of Mycobacterium bovis, bacillus Calmette-Guerin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
